```{r}
load("data/bound-data.Rdata")

# install.packages("dplyr")
library(dplyr)

# install.packages("tidyr")
library(tidyr)

# install.packages("ggplot2",dependencies=TRUE)
library(ggplot2)

# This was to change the Week variable from a character to a

# factor, so it can be included in the plot.

datab$Week1 <- as.factor(datab$Week)

#This is the plot. It works but now we need to group it per

# species and per treatment.

datab$Species[datab$Species=="Amaranthus retroflexus"] <- "Amaranthus retroflexus"

 
mean_species <- datab %>%
  filter(Species == "Lolium rigidum")

mean_species <- mean_species %>%
  group_by(Species, Treatment, Week) %>%
  summarise(Mean_plant_height = mean(Plant_height))

ggplot(mean_species, aes(x=Week, y=Mean_plant_height, color=Treatment, group = Treatment))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()

 

 
#for loop, child

```
